Nonton Bareng Film Hanya Manusia, Polda Jabar Ajak Masyarakat Mawas Perdagangan Manusia
07 Nov 2019, 22:29 by Mochammad Iqbal Maulud
HUMAS Polda Jabar adakan nonton bareng film Hanya Manusia yang dibintangi Prisia Nasution, Lian Firman dan Yama Carlos. Seperti diketahui film tersebut merupakan film diinisiasi oleh Divisi Humas Mabes Polri.
Film berdurasi 1 jam 31 menit itu merupakan film yang bercerita mengenai kehidupan beberapa perwira reserse kepolisian. Para perwira tersebut bertugas di Unit Perlindungan Perempuan dan Anak di Polres Metro Jakarta Utara.
Meski dengan anggaran yang dibilang tidak terlalu besar tetapi film tersebut cukup baik. Apalagi disisipi dengan humor-humor ringan khas polisi. Sedikit kejutan-kejutan ringan pun ada dalam film tersebut, sehingga akan banyak membuat penontonnya tertawa.
Film ini secara umum menceritakan tentang perdagangan manusia yang menyasar anak-anak di bawah umur. Diperlihatkan juga bagaimana korban-korban perdagangan manusia ini diperlakukan bahkan hampir seperti binatang.
Kabid Humas Polda Jabar, Komisaris Besar Polisi Trunoyudo Wisnu Andiko memberikan pendapatnya. Menurut Truno acara nonton bareng ini adalah sebagai bentuk kepedulian Polri terhadap media. Apalagi media selama ini telah membantu Polri dalam mempublikasikan keberhasilan-keberhasilan Polri di lapangan.
"Ini juga sebagai bentuk silaturahmi Polda Jabar terhadap teman‎-teman media. Selain juga untuk kembali mengingatkan tugas Polri di lapangan yang terkadang berat, bahkan sering menyita waktu," katanya di XXI Ciwalk, Jalan Cihampelas, Kota Bandung pada Kamis 7 November 2019.
Truno memaparkan keseharian Polri yang penuh dengan resiko diceritakan dalam film tersebut. Bahkan tidak jarang dari teman-teman Polri rela mengorbankan jiwa dan raganya bagi masyarakat. Khususnya di tempat mereka bertugas.
"Tugas Polri seperti diketahui adalah mengayomi dan melayani masyarakat. Tetapi tentunya tugas utamanya adalah memberikan rasa aman dan nyaman bagi masyarakat," ucapnya.
Oleh karena itu Truno pun berharap dengan penayangan film tersebut, masyarakat bisa lebih paham tentang tugas dan fungsi Polri di lapangan.‎ Terutama yang berkaitan dengan hak asasi manusia, khususnya pada kalangan perempuan dan anak.
"Meski Polri dipastikan akan terus melakukan tindakan terhadap kegiatan ilegal tersebut, tetapi masyarakat juga diminta pro aktif. Segera laporkan apabila ada indikasi-indikasi perdagangan manusia, meski banyak terjadi di perdesaan tetapi hal ini tidak menutup kemungkinan pula terjadi di perkotaan," ucapnya.***

Watching with Only Human Film, West Java Regional Police Invites the Mawas Human Trafficking Society
Nov 7 2019, 22:29 by Mochammad Iqbal Maulud
West Java Regional Police HUMAS is watching together with the film "Just Humans," starring Prisia Nasution, Lian Firman and Yama Carlos. As is known the film is a film initiated by the Public Relations Division of the National Police Headquarters.
The 1 hour 31 minute film is a film that tells the life of several police detective officers. The officers served in the Women's and Child Protection Unit at North Jakarta Metro Police.
Even though the budget is not too big but the film is quite good. Moreover, interpolated with mild humor typical of the police. Even a few light surprises are in the film, so that it will make the audience laugh a lot.
This film generally tells about human trafficking targeting minors. It also shows how victims of human trafficking are treated even almost like animals.
West Java Regional Police Head of Public Relations, Police Commissioner Trunoyudo Wisnu Andiko gave his opinion. According to Truno, this watching together program is a form of Polri's concern for the media. Moreover, the media has been assisting the National Police in publicizing Polri's successes in the field.
"This is also a form of West Java Regional Police gathering to friends of the media. In addition to reminding Polri's task in the field which is sometimes hard, even time consuming," he said at XXI Ciwalk, Jalan Cihampelas, Bandung on Thursday 7 November 2019.
Truno explained the daily police life that was full of risks told in the film. In fact, it is not uncommon for Polri friends to sacrifice their lives and bodies for the community. Especially where they work.
"The task of the National Police as it is known is to protect and serve the community. But of course the main task is to provide security and comfort for the community," he said.
Therefore Truno hopes that by showing the film, the public will be able to understand more about the tasks and functions of the National Police in the field, especially those relating to human rights, especially among women and children.
"Even though the National Police will certainly continue to take action against these illegal activities, the community is also asked to be pro-active. Report immediately if there are indications of human trafficking, although many occur in rural areas, but this does not rule out the possibility of urban areas," he said. **
